channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report E-2024110263
item.description:
Report E-2024110263

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-18T12:24:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-07
  • City: MARIETTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On November 7, 2024, one (1) 275-gallon tote of X-111 55GL was punctured by a forklift and released approximately 145-gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized soda ash, absorbents, and hand tools to remove the released product. A tote transfer was completed. All impacted materials were containerized in seven (7) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024110290
item.description:
Report E-2024110290

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-18T12:24:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-06
  • City: BUTLER
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PVS STEEL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On November 6, 2024, a spill incident occurred at the Heidtman Butler facility involving an overfill of a tanker truck. During a product transfer operation, the driver failed to actively monitor the flow from the dome of the tanker truck, which is required to prevent overflow. Instead, the driver was standing at the back of the trailer, timing the transfer rather than visually overseeing the product flow from the dome. As a result, approximately 300 gallons of ferrous chloride solution (372 pounds) overflowed from the tanker, spilling onto the facilityâ€™s limestone gravel bed.

item.title: Report E-2024110252
item.description:
Report E-2024110252

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-15T12:23:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-09
  • City: ANDREWS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PETROLEUM TRANSPORTS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Driver allowed CTMV to drift onto the right shoulder of the roadway. The driver over corrected to the left, which caused the CTMV to roll onto its right side. This caused about a 2 to 3 foot cut into the tank. Approximately 3,500 gallons of unleaded gasoline spilled onto the shoulder of the roadway. The Texas Department of Public Safety responded to the scene and notified United Petroleum Transports, Inc. UPT then contracted an Environmental Clean up Service. The Environmental Clean up Service went the scene and contained the spill. It the went through the process of removing the contaminated soil and replacing it with clean soil. The final remediation was done on 11/11/2024 and report was sent to TXDEQ. Fortunately, the spill occurred in an unpopulated area so no people, homes, or business were affected.
